intro: Phelipanche nikitae, commonly known as the Nikita's morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pale purple to white in color. It is native to regions of southern Europe and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
